intro: Microtis benthamiana, commonly known as the Benthams' microtis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal regions. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a species of conservation interest.
